body:
The Go memory model is at https://golang.org/ref/mem .  You will likely find it unsatisfactory.  See also #5045, #7948, and #9442.

In any case, the Go memory model is for user code.  It does not describe the requirements on the Go runtime itself.  That is, the Go memory model describes the sync/atomic package, or, more precisely, it should describe that package but doesn't.  The Go memory model does not describe the runtime/internal/atomic package, which is what the runtime uses.
